Welcome to PoliOrari’s documentation!¶

Contents:

‘politoschedule’ module for querying Politecnico di Torino’s time tables

module:politoschedule
class politoschedule.Course(json_dict)¶

Information about a single course

__init__(json_dict)¶

Create a new Course object

Return type:Course
Parameters:json_dict – the dictionary describing a course, returned by Json parsing
alpha_range = None¶

Alphabetical sub-group

key = None¶

Unique key

pd = None¶

Periodo Didattico (Semester)

teacher = None¶

Teacher name

topic = None¶

Topic (course name)

class politoschedule.Event(json_dict)¶

Information about a single scheduled event (class or exam)

__init__(json_dict)¶

Create a new Event object.

Beware: the JSON information is parsed into meaningful fields. The parsing code is extremely fragile, and may break if slight modification are made to the JSON content.

Return type:Event
Parameters:json_dict – the dictionary describing a scheduled event, returned by Json parsing
dontknow = None¶

???? (always empty???)

end = None¶

end time, as a datetime object

end_str = None¶

end time, as a string

id = None¶

Unique key

notes = None¶

Notes (e.g, SQUADRA)

room = None¶

Full room description (e.g., ‘Aula 3’)

roomname = None¶

Room name (e.g., ‘3’)

start = None¶

start time, as a datetime object

start_str = None¶

start time, as a string

teacher = None¶

Teacher (last name only)

text = None¶

full description of the event (includes HTML)

topic = None¶

Course name

class politoschedule.Room(json_dict)¶

Information about a single classroom

__init__(json_dict)¶

Create a new Room object

Return type:Room
Parameters:json_dict – the dictionary describing a classroom, returned by Json parsing
politoschedule.find_courses_by_text(text)¶

Searches the full list of available courses and returns the ones whose description, or whose teacher name, matches the parameter ‘text’.

Parameters:text (str) – string to search (in course name, and teacher name)
Returns:the list of matching courses
Return type:list[Course]
politoschedule.find_events_by_courses(courses, date)¶

Searches the full list of events for a list of specified courses. The events are bound to one week before and two weeks later than the specified date.

Parameters:
  • courses (list[str]) – a list of course IDs (taken from the field “chiave” in the find_courses_by_text result)
  • date (datetime.date) – the date around which the events are extracted (suggestion: datetime.date.today())
Returns:

a list of events describing all the classes (in future, also exams) for anyof the courses
Return type:

list[event]
politoschedule.find_events_by_room(room, date)¶

Searches the full list of events for a list of specified courses. The events are bound to one week before and two weeks later than the specified date.

Parameters:
  • room (str) – the name of the classroom (taken from Room.name)
  • date (datetime.date) – the date around which the events are extracted (suggestion: datetime.date.today())
Returns:

a list of events describing all the classes (in future, also exams) for the room
Return type:

list[Event]
politoschedule.get_all_classrooms()¶

Searches the full list of classrooms.

Returns:a complete(?) list of classrooms all the classes in Politecnico
Return type:list[Room]
